se.westpay.posapplib

Class TerminalSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.westpay.posapplib.TerminalSettings

  • public class TerminalSettings
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains settings required by the payment application. All of these settings, except for terminalId are optional, and can be left out.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TerminalSettings

        public TerminalSettings(java.lang.String terminalId)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        terminalId - The terminal id that this payment terminal should use.

      • TerminalSettings

        public TerminalSettings(java.lang.String terminalId,
                        java.lang.String[] authHosts,
                        java.lang.String[] confHosts)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        terminalId - The terminal id that this payment terminal should use.
        authHosts - Optional. The address(es) of the authorisation host.
        confHosts - Optional. The address(es) of the configuration host.

      • TerminalSettings

        public TerminalSettings(java.lang.String terminalId,
                        java.lang.String[] authHosts,
                        java.lang.String[] confHosts,
                        boolean forceLogin)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        terminalId - The terminal id that this payment terminal should use.
        authHosts - Optional. The address(es) of the authorisation host.
        confHosts - Optional. The address(es) of the configuration host.
        forceLogin - Force a connection to the configuration and authorisation hosts.

    • Method Detail

      • getAuthorisationHosts

        public java.lang.String[] getAuthorisationHosts()
        Returns:
        The addresses to the authorisation host.

      • setAuthorisationHosts

        public void setAuthorisationHosts(java.lang.String... hosts)
        Parameters:
        hosts - Zero, or more addresses to the host(s) that should be used for transaction authorisation. Each address should be an IP-address, followed by a port number.

        Example: 185.27.171.42:55144 is the address of the Westpay test host.

        Note! The payment application only supports two addresses at most - one primary address, and a backup.

      • getConfigurationHosts

        public java.lang.String[] getConfigurationHosts()
        Returns:
        The addresses to the terminal configuration host.

      • setConfigurationHosts

        public void setConfigurationHosts(java.lang.String... hosts)
        Parameters:
        hosts - Zero, or more addresses to the host(s) that should be used for terminal configuration. Each address should be an IP-address, followed by a port number.

        Example: 185.27.171.42:55133 is the address of the Westpay test host.

        Note! The payment application only supports two addresses at most - one primary address, and a backup.

      • getLanguage

        public java.lang.String getLanguage()
        Returns:
        The primary language that the terminal should use.

      • setLanguage

        public void setLanguage(java.lang.String value)
        Parameters:
        value - The primary language that should be used in the payment terminal. The language must be specified using 3 letter ISO639-2 codes.

        The currently implemented languages in the payment terminal are:

        1. dan - Danish
        2. deu - German
        3. eng - English
        4. fin - Finnish
        5. nor - Norwegian
        6. pol - Polish
        7. swe - Swedish

        Note! The select language has to be both implemented and enabled by the terminal configuration.

      • getTerminalId

        public java.lang.String getTerminalId()
        Gets the terminal id used by this payment terminal. The terminal id is an 8 digit number that uniquely identifies this terminal.

      • getForceLogin

        public boolean getForceLogin()
        Gets the value of the force login flag. The force login flag forces a connection to the configuration and the authorisation hosts.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • setForceLogin

        public void setForceLogin(boolean forceLogin)
        Sets the value of the force login flag. The force login flag forces a connection to the configuration and the authorisation hosts.
        Parameters:
        forceLogin - True to force a connection, false otherwise.
